content.description: Start on opposing crimps with one foot and make a difficult move to a jug rail, continue straight up to a jug on the lip and find some magic to top out. I used the crack with the adjoining boulder on the right for a foot to top out. Bad Landing
content.protection: Several Pads - Landing could use some work!
content.location: From Ice Nine hike approximately 500 feet to the east on the base. Walk up the hill past Solar Slab and Stool pigeon is the overhanging face perched between a few boulders.

content.description: Climb the awesome pillar with a low crux and glorious top out jugs - decent landing but it's nice to have pads for this one.
content.location: If you have located Tuckwave - continue up and right through some boulders to a large cooridor. Hard to miss this feature.

content.description: Crouch start on and obvious crimp rail in the roof - make a few difficult moves to achieve the lip to a challenging mantle followed by an easy cruise up the slab. We cleaned out most of the garbage but you may see remnants of the bum camp.

The Sauna is a large pile of boulders with plenty of problems to choose from. Lots of direct sun exposure in this area make it quite nice in the bitter cold of winter. Best problems are Over 9,000 and
